description.narrative: Projects in developing countries, unspecified. KIOS funds human rights projects which are implemented by NGOs in its focus areas in East Africa and South Asia. The focus countries are mainly fragile societies and the work of KIOS is based on country strate gies that take into account the strategy and key functions of KIOS the existing human rights work in the country rights of women and vulnerable groups. The objective is that the civil society promotes the commitment of states to human rights in the legisla tion in their implementation and in other forms. The aim is to engender a transformation in which the respect for human rights increases and the human rights situation improves. The civil society can play a key part of such change and can promote the soci al dialogue needed for the change to take place. The human rights work that is based on local ownership is likely to support long-term development and to prevent contradictions to escalate into conflicts.KIOS promotes the realization of human rights in dev eloping countries in the form that human rights are defined in the UN and other human rights instruments. KIOS supports the work of human rights defenders and does advocacy work especially to support human rights defenders in high-risk situations. It is im portant to support human rights organizations that work in hardening contexts in order to improve the awareness of the universal human rights in different countries and cultures.The work of funding human rights projects requires interaction with the projec t partners. In order to support the local ownership the projects are based on local initiatives of the project partners. The content and the financial reporting of projects are closely monitored. On average KIOS funds approximately 60 on-going projects sim ultaneously.Human rights communications and global education increase the awareness of the importance of human rights in the development cooperation policy. In this work KIOS take utilizes its extensive networks the results of its partners? projects as wel l as the rich knowledge of the work and conditions of human rights defenders in developing countries.
